page.title: 06A LOCAL NET FACTORY
page.content: There are two small family-owned net factories in Porthleven. One belongs to Russell Cowls and his wife, who acts as secretary. The business goes back four generations. His machinery is obsolete dating from the sixties, but cannot be replaced because of the cost of new equipment. There are three machines making square meshes. The diamond meshes have to be made by several ladies upstairs who pin the nets on the walls and use wooden needles. The building is very old. One of the walls is bolstered with timber. The rooms are small and narrow. Many different nets are made. The main ones are fishing nets, which are sent to Newlyn to be made into trawl nets, cray fish nets, crab pot nets, gardening nets and sports nets. Occasionally nets are exported. Many of his materials are imported.
